cells.data:
Big-O continued.

Limit definitions!
$\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} = \infty \iff f(n) \in o(g(n))$
$\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} \lt \infty \iff f(n) \in O(g(n))$
$0 \lt \lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} \lt \infty \iff f(n) \in \Theta(g(n))$
$\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} \gt 0 \iff f(n) \in \Omega(g(n))$
$\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{f(n)}{g(n)} = 0 \iff f(n) \in \omega(g(n))$

Transitivity and reflexivity
Symmetry and Complementarity

$lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{n^b}{a^n} = 0 \implies n^b = o(a^n)$

Log identities:
$\log_ba = \frac{1}{\log_ab}$
$a^{\log_bc} = c^{\log_ba}$
